name: Victorian Vampire  Bustle Dress in your Custom Size and Fabrics
description: This made to order Victorian bustle dress is just perfect for Halloween. It incorporates traditional vampire costume elements into Victorian era costume shapes, and the result is sultry and Gothic yet historically based. Perfect for your next costume party or Halloween. This listing is for a custom version of the dress photographed, made to your measurements and in a cotton brocade fabric and trims of your choosing. The original fabrics are no longer in stock. The bodice is lightly boned and can be worn without a corset (as in the photos). The example gown closes center front with frog closures, however, this could be changed to lacing, buttons, or any closure of your choosing. The skirt features an apron drape and back bustle drape which is adjustable via hidden ties. A mockup of the bodice will be sent to check fit before cutting the fashion fabric. I have a background in historical theatrical costuming, and so all of my garments are made with the utmost attention to detail, quality, and above all, durability. NOTE: The actual bustle understructure is not included. if you are in need of one to go with this dress, I have a bustle pads available in my ready to ship Etsy shop. Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to discuss current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: Custom Medieval Gown Princess Dress Wool/Linen LARP gown
description: This listing is for a custom version of the gown photographed above, made in your measurements. This gown would be perfect for a renaissance festival, LARP event, or Halloween. It features multiple princess seams which fit flatteringly through the hips and then flare out into a gorgeous, full hem. It will be made in a wool or linen fabric in a color of your choosing. The dress has a faked, contrasting cotton "underdress", which peeks out at the neckline and through the slashes in the sleeves. This underdress extends to the hip, and lines the bodice. The sleeves flare out a bit past the wrist into a soft point on the top of the hands. The gown laces up center back through loops, and has a modesty placket to prevent skin showing. I will need the following: bust waist hip back of neck to waist waist to floor with appropriate shoes Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: Italian Rennaisance Chemise Linen Romantic 16th Century, custom order
description: This made to order chemise is based on styles worn in Italy in the 16th century. It is very full and made of high quality handkerchief weight linen gathered to a neck band. It is made with historically accurate rectangular pattern shapes, and french seams for durability. The sleeves are extra full and long, allowing you to puff them out through your gown sleeves (if you would like the sleeves without the extra length, let me know). The chemise is made approximately calf-length. It is one size fits most, but if you have any size concerns please let me know. Machine wash and dry on delicate/warm cycles. The linen gets softer with wear, making this a lovely addition to your 16th century wardrobe. Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: Elizabethan Reed Corset, Custom Made Stays in Your Size and Fabrics
description: This is a custom listing of the Elizabethan corset photographed above, made to your measurements and in a silk fashion fabric in a color of your choosing (can also be done in linen). This corset accurately re-creates the conical shape of the Tudor era and 16th century. The straps add support, and the tabs at the waist act as a buffer between your waist/hips and heavy skirts. It is fully boned in front and half boned in back with reed boning. The reed is remarkably light and comfortable, and quite strong! The corset, or "stays", will have an inner strength layer of cotton coutil, silk fashion fabric, and a lining of twill. The corset will lace up center back with gold or silver grommets, in a "spiral lacing" pattern. You can upgrade to hand-bound eyelets for $70 for a truly historically accurate look. This is perfect for underneath a Renaissance or Elizabethan costume, or wear your corset to renfair over a chemise and show it off! For bust measurements over 42", I will use a mixture of reed and steel boning through the front, for added support. I will need to know the following: -Bust measurement -Bra size -Waist measurement -Underarm to waist measurement (taken with your arm relaxed at your side) -Desired fashion fabric color. The last photo shows the silks I have in stock which you may choose from (white and black are also available but not pictured), or I can special order a different color for you. Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: Custom Elizabethan Gown Ensemble in your size and fabrics
description: This listing is for a custom version of the ensembles shown, made to your measurements and in colors of your choosing. This gorgeous Elizabethan style is perfect for renfair, stage, Halloween...anytime you want to feel like a queen! The gown consists of a hooped farthingale, bum roll, an underskirt with "forepart," an overskirt, a boned bodice, and a partlet. The exact style can be customized almost any way you want, and I love working with clients to create the dress of their dreams. Both of the gowns photographed are made of brocade and cotton velvet, with gold metallic trim and faux pearls, and these types of materials are figured into the listing price. Please understand that if more elaborate materials or designs are chosen, this will affect the cost of the gown. This gown is based upon historical research, but has a definite "theatrical" bent. It is meant to be pretty and flattering, while achieving the look of 16th century England. I am trained as a theatrical costume technician, and so all of my costumes are high quality and made to last. The bodice will have a sturdy twill interlining and steel boning, and will lace in back with silver or gold grommets*. The amount of boning included in the bodice makes a corset unnecessary for most body types. To ensure an accurate fit, a mockup of the bodice will be shipped to you prior to cutting the fashion fabric. *can be upgraded to hand bound eyelets for a more historically accurate look for an additional $70 Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: 18th Century Stays in Silk, custom corset in your size
description: The luxurious version of my 18th century stays, this listing is for a custom version of the corset photographed above, made to your measurements and in a silk fashion fabric of your choosing. These stays are based upon existing corsets of the 18th century in both pattern and construction. The corset will be constructed from English cotton coutil lined with cotton twill, with an outer layer of shimmering silk. The edges will be bound in either matching silk or a fine cream Egyptian cotton. Each tab is meticulously bound with a combination of machine and hand sewing, ensuring a smooth, durable finish with no visible stitches. It is boned with 2 types of boning--steel and historically-accurate reed boning. The steels give more strength to the reed in key areas, but the reed allows the entire front of the corset to be boned without adding the weight of the steel. It also gives a lovely, slightly raised appearance to the boning channels, which mimics more closely the look of period corsets. An interior waist tape will be incorporated so that the waist will not stretch. Two metal bones span the front of the bust horizontally, and these help with the conical decolletage and silhouette popular in the 18th century. A wooden, removable busk is included. The corset will lace up center back with silver grommets (can be switched to gold by request). This can be changed to hand bound eyelets for an additional $50 fee. If you would like the upgrade, contact me and I will create a custom listing for you. I will need to know the following, which you may add to the "Message to Seller" at checkout, or email or convo to me after purchase: -Bust measurement -Bra size -Waist measurement -Underarm to waist measurement (taken with your arm relaxed at your side) -Desired fashion fabric color. The last photo shows the silks I have in stock which you may choose from (white and black are also available but not pictured), or I can special order a different color for you. Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: Custom Medieval Gown in Linen, Renaissance Dress with Bell Sleeves
description: Re-live the days of chivalry and romance in this flattering linen medieval gown, custom made to your measurements and in your choice of color. This gown would be perfect for LARP, Faire, SCA or Halloween. Deceptively simple, the multiple seamed design (9 panels in all) flatters the figure and allows for a very full, dramatic skirt. It is fitted through the bust and waist, flaring out from hip to hem. The gown laces up in back with a series of loops and black or matching cord. A modesty panel spans the gap. The sleeves are full but not cumbersome, adding graceful movement to the silhouette. As with all of my costumes, this garment is high quality and will be made to last. The bodice will be flatlined to the hip with an additional layer of linen for structure and durability. All interior edges are serged, and hems are machine topstitched for durability. The sleeve seams are stitched with french seams, since the interior of the sleeve is visible. This style is also very flexible, depending upon how you accessorize it: dress it up as shown with a fancy belt or sash (not included), or dress it down for a peasant look with a leather or rope belt. I will need the following measurements: Bust measurement Waist measurement Waist to floor measurement Back of neck to waist and preferred color (choice is subject to current availability, though I will do my best to find the exact shade you desire) Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: Custom Elizabethan Hat, Women's Renfair Hat with Feathers and Velvet
description: This listing is for a customized version of the Elizabethan hat photographed, in any of the available shades of cotton velvet, and trimmed with ostrich plumes and decadent gold bullion trim fit for a queen (or anyone who wishes to look fabulous at Faire). I can also do this hat in your own provided fabric to match your gown. The hat has a mid-height crown, with the velvet pulled over the handmade buckram frame (my own pattern) in artfully arranged folds. The edge of the wired brim will be finished with a coordinating fabric or sawtooth edged grosgrain ribbon. Your hat will be lined with silk taffeta, and will include a sweatband, a classic millinery detail. This style is meant to "perch," not fit around the head. I include four synthetic horsehair tabs along the sweatband, allowing you to bobby pin the hat to your hairstyle. Of course, if you have a hat pin, that can be used as well. I have been trained in theatrical buckram millinery techniques, and this hat is made to hold up to many years of normal wear. Because of the buckram, care should be taken that it does not get wet. Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: 18th Century Stays, Custom Made Cotton Corset in Your Size
description: This is a custom listing of the corset photographed above, made to your measurements and in a solid 100% cotton fashion fabric in a color of your choosing. This corset is based upon existing corsets of the 18th century in both pattern and construction. Wear it under your court gown or as part of your pastoral peasant costume. The corset will be constructed from English cotton coutil lined with cotton twill, cotton fashion fabric, cream cotton bias binding. It is boned with two types of boning--steel and historically-accurate reed boning. The reed allows the entire front of the corset to be boned, while remaining very lightweight. It also gives a lovely, slightly raised appearance to the boning channels, which mimics more closely the look of period corsets. An interior waist tape will be incorporated so that the waist will not stretch. Two metal bones span the front of the bust horizontally, these help with the conical decolletage and silhouette popular in the 18th century. The straps extend from the high back (which really helps maintain the perfect posture of the period) and tie onto the front. Busk pocket and removable wooden busk included. The corset will spiral lace up center back with silver grommets. This can be changed to hand bound eyelets for an additional $70 fee. If you would like the upgrade, contact me and I will create a custom listing with the correct price for you to purchase. I will need to know the following: -Bust measurement -Bra size -Waist measurement -Underarm to waist measurement (taken with your arm relaxed at your side) -Desired cotton fashion fabric color. An attached image or link to an example of the color you would like is very helpful. Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: Custom 1780's Zone Front Gown, Marie Antoinette Style
description: Get ready for the French Revolution in this custom gown based upon research into fashions worn in Europe during the 1780's. It is a gorgeous, flattering shape with a multi-seamed back, interesting zone-front detail and tight sleeves, perfect for your next Marie Antoinette themed party. It will be made to your measurements and in a silk taffeta color of your choosing. The silk is decadent and makes a fabulous rustling sound when walking. The gown will be made to appear as historically accurate as possible, all visible stitching done by hand, including the hand bound buttonholes and hand covered buttons. This gown will be made with lots of pretty details! Cream or black silk satin ribbons lace through hand bound eyelets at the wrist, these can hang loose or be tied in a bow. A similar looped trim in black, cream, or other color or trim of your choosing finishes off the zone front. The skirt will be knife-pleated to the bodice, and the graceful point in the back of the bodice is flattering and elegant. This gown listing consists of a silk petticoat, overdress with split front, and a bum roll for the correct silhouette. I highly recommend the wearing of stays (corset) with this dress, as it is not heavily boned. The model is not wearing a corset in the photos, and as you can see, it is not as smooth through the bodice as it should be. This is a custom order and will take a number of weeks to complete. Please contact me before purchase if you have a specific deadline. This style is fully customizable to your specifications. Please understand that additional design details will incur additional cost. I will need the following measurements: Bust Bra Size Waist Back of neck to Waist Waist to floor with appropriate shoes Shoulder to wrist with arm at side Shoulder to bust Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: Elizabethan Effigy Corset Stays
description: The perfect base for your late Elizabethan garb--a custom version of the Effigy Stays, made to your measurements and in a shade of linen of your choosing. My pattern for these Elizabethan stays is based closely upon the extant "Effigy" stays worn by the effigy of Queen Elizabeth I. It re-creates the conical shape of the 16th century, and features a deep front point, front lacing for ease in dressing, a high back for support and posture, boned tabs, and straps. It is fully boned throughout with historically accurate reed, or "bents." The reed is remarkably light and comfortable, and quite strong! The two bones at the front are steel, to support the lacing. The corset, or "stays", will have an inner strength layer of high quality imported English cotton coutil, and a lining of twill. You get to choose the color of linen you would like for your fashion fabric. I can also make them in a solid cotton, or silk for an additional $15. Thirty hand-bound eyelets are the finishing touch to the authentic look of this corset. Grommets can be substituted if desired (which will reduce the price by $70). This corset is meant to lace closed center front, and will be made 2" smaller than your measurements to allow for squish and a little stretch. It can also be made with center back lacing instead for no additional charge, or both front and back lacing for an additional $50. For busts over 42", a combination of reed and steel will be used through the front of the corset, for added support. Measurements required: Bust Underbust Waist Underarm to waist, measured with arm relaxed at side Back of neck to waist US bra size Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.

name: Venetian Renaissance Gown
description: A custom order Venetian gown, based on the styles of the 1500's, and in fabrics of your choosing. Utmost care will be taken to create a dress that looks historically correct, is durable, and comfortable to wear. This Renaissance style features a deep, v-shaped front opening bodice, which laces in a striking, historically-accurate "ladder" lacing style. The steel boned bodice will be constructed from a double layer of canvas, allowing it to be worn without a corset, while creating that rigid, conical look of the time period. The sleeves attach to the shoulder straps with buttons and elastic loops, or ribbon ties.The wide neckline falls off the shoulders somewhat, highlighting the decolletage. Fabric for the gown can be silk, brocade, velvet, etc, depending on your wishes. The skirt is "cartridge pleated" to the bodice, an historically accurate technique. I include deep pockets in the side seams, so that you can easily hide your wallet/camera/other 21st century items at Faire. The sleeves are based on historical portraits. They are straight, but roomy, and taper to a tight wrist. The chemise can be pulled through slits in the top for a decorative effect. Your sleeves can be trimmed with lace, buttons, etc at the cuff. A linen chemise, also included with this dress, is decadently full and gathered to a band at the neck. It has extra long sleeves for pulling through the oversleeves, and is calf-length. PEARL GIRDLE/BELT NOT INCLUDED. Please see my Policies Page for current production lead times, as these can be up to 4 months during busy seasons. Email me at redthreadedcs@gmail.com if you have any questions prior to purchase, or if you would like to set up a payment plan. I will contact you after purchase to confirm current processing times, measurements, fabric choices, and any additional information needed for your order.
